https://trustmark.gtri.gatech.edu/operational-pilot/trustmark-definitions/nief-full-disclosure-requirements-for-spos/1.0/ https://trustmark.gtri.gatech.edu/operational-pilot/trustmark-definitions/nief-full-disclosure-requirements-for-spos/1.0/trustmark-reference/ NIEF Full Disclosure Requirements for SPOs 1.0 NIEF full disclosure requirements for SPOs. 2014-10-07T09:57:01 https://trustmark.gtri.gatech.edu/ Georgia Tech Research Institute PRIMARY TrustmarkFeedback@gtri.gatech.edu 404-407-8956 75 5th Street NW, Suite 900, Atlanta, GA 30308 NIEF stakeholders. NIEF participants. NIEF participants. The NIEF Center or other Trustmark Providers endorsed by The NIEF Center.

The NIEF Center is the only organization that may act as a Trustmark Provider for trustmarks under this Trustmark Definition.

]]>

Any individual employed or contracted by the Trustmark Provider may act as the assessor for trustmarks under this Trustmark Definition.

]]>

For any trustmark issued under this Trustmark Definition, the Trustmark Provider must revoke the trustmark upon any condition whereby one or more Conformance Criteria cease to be satisfied.

]]>

This Trustmark Definition requires no extension data.

]]> This document and the information contained herein is provided on an "AS IS" basis, and the Georgia Tech Research Institute disclaims all warranties, express or implied, including but not limited to any warranty that the use of the information herein will not infringe any rights or any implied warranties or merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. In addition, the Georgia Tech Research Institute disclaims legal liability for any loss incurred as a result of the use or reliance on the document or the information contained herein. The Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI) has published this document with the support of the National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace (NSTIC) via the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST). The views expressed herein do not necessarily reflect the official policies of GTRI, NIST or NSTIC; nor does mention of trade names, commercial practices, or organizations imply endorsement by the U.S. Government. Attribute Provider Organization APO An identity federation member organization that vets and collects specific attributes about individuals, maintains those attributes in an accurate and timely manner, and provides those attributes to other organizations in the identity federation as needed, subject to applicable attribute release and privacy policies, for access control and auditing purposes. An APO operates one or more Attribute Provider (AP) software entities in an identity federation. Also see the NIEF Terminology Matrix.

]]> Authority-to-Operate Documentation Documentation that attests to the organization's authority to operate as a particular NIEF role under a specific legal jurisdiction.

]]> Federation Management Office FMO A management organization (usually comprised of identity federation members) that is responsible for the governance, policies, procedures and implementation of the identity federation and its bridged-federation alliances. Also see the NIEF Terminology Matrix.

]]> Global Federated Identity and Privilege Management GFIPM The GFIPM framework provides various communities of interest and partner organizations with a standards-based approach for implementing federated identity.

]]> Identity Federation Management Office IFMO See Federation Management Office.

]]> Identity Provider Organization IDPO An identity federation member organization that vets individuals, collects attributes about these individuals, and maintains those attributes in an accurate and timely manner. The IDPO operates one or more Identity Provider (IDP) entities, and may also operate one or more SAML Assertion Delegate Service (ADS) entities, in an identity federation. Also see the NIEF Terminology Matrix.

]]> Local Security Policy A document describing the security policy that is currently in place within an organization.

]]> Local User Agreement Documentation describing the security policies that are currently in place within an organization.

]]> Local User Vetting Policies and Procedures Documentation describing the user vetting policies and procedures that are currently in place within an organization.

]]> National Identity Exchange Federation NIEF A trust framework for trusted identity and authentication attributes information sharing based on the GFIPM suite of specifications and policy templates.

]]> NIEF Access Control Policy Map A document describing how an organization, operating in a particular NIEF role, plans to map its local access control policies into rules that can be expressed using attributes from the NIEF Attribute Registry.

]]> NIEF Application Form A standard NIEF form on which an organization provides basic organization information about itself, e.g., name, address, names and titles of its organizational officers.

]]> NIEF Attribute Map A document describing how an organization, operating in a particular NIEF role, plans to map its local policies and locally stored user attributes into attributes from the NIEF Attribute Registry.

]]> NIEF Attribute Registry A registry that contains a set of attributes that may be used within NIEF.

]]> NIEF Brokered IDPO Registry Form A document that provides the name, description, and identifier of each IDPO that a TIBO will broker.

]]> NIEF Center The governing body of the NIEF trust framework.

]]> NIEF Security Practices Checklist A checklist that summarizes an organization's local security policy. The checklist is "For Information Only." NIEF applicants are not required to be compliant with all items on the checklist.

]]> Service Consumer Organization SCO An identity federation member organization that operates one or more Web Service Consumer (WSC) software entities in an identity federation. Also see the NIEF Terminology Matrix.

]]> Service Provider Organization SPO An identity federation member organization that operates one or more SAML Service Provider (SP) and/or Web Service Provider (WSP) software entities in an identity federation. Also see the NIEF Terminology Matrix.

]]> NIEF-OPP The NIEF Center Operational Policies and Procedures is available from NIEF by request. https://nief.gfipm.net

]]> 1 Submission of the NIEF Application The organization MUST submit a completed NIEF Application to the NIEF FMO.

]]> Section 6.2: Application Process]]> 2 Submission of ATO documentation The organization MUST submit a completed SPO Authority-to-Operate documentation to the NIEF FMO.

]]> Section 6.2: Application Process]]> 3 Submission of the security policy The organization MUST submit documentation that comprises its local security policy to the NIEF FMO.

]]> Section 6.2: Application Process]]> 4 Submission of the NIEF Access Control Policy Map The organization MUST submit a completed NIEF Access Control Policy Map for SPOs to the NIEF FMO.

]]> Section 6.2: Application Process]]> 5 Submission of the NIEF Security Practices Checklist The organization MUST submit a completed NIEF Security Practices Checklist to the NIEF FMO.

]]> Section 6.2: Application Process]]> 1 Verify the submission of the NIEF Application Has the trustmark applicant submitted a completed NIEF Application to the NIEF FMO? Provide the completed NIEF Application.

]]> Application The completed NIEF Application.

]]> 2 Verify the submission of ATO documentation Has the trustmark applicant submitted completed SPO Authority-to-Operate documentation to the NIEF FMO? Provide the completed ATO.

]]> ATO The completed ATO.

]]> 3 Verify the submission of the security policy Has the trustmark applicant submitted documentation that comprises its local security policy to the NIEF FMO? Provide the local security policy documentation.

]]> Security Policy The local security policy documentation.

]]> 4 Verify the submission of the NIEF Access Control Policy Map Has the trustmark applicant submitted a completed NIEF Access Control Policy Map for SPOs to the NIEF FMO? Provide the completed NIEF Access Control Policy Map.

]]> Policy Map The completed NIEF Access Control Policy Map.

]]> 5 Verify the submission of the NIEF Security Practices Checklist Has the trustmark applicant submitted a completed NIEF Security Practices Checklist to the NIEF FMO? Provide the completed NIEF Security Practices Checklist.

]]> Security Practices Checklist The completed NIEF Security Practices Checklist.

]]> yes(ALL)
